stories.title: The Global Minecraft Team Building New York City

stories.text:
TLDR: I'm building a cryptography puzzle game. Try it out at: https://clujhunt.com/ciphers

Hey, HN!

I'm Tudor and I'm working on a puzzle game where you solve increasingly difficult ciphers using a custom coded decryption tool that should make the process more enjoyable. After you solve each puzzle, you are rewarded with pieces of a story about a cryptography enthusiast, set in 1930s Germany.

The hardest part of this project was building the accompanying decryption tool. I wanted it to be mobile-friendly and it’s the part I iterated on the most, after receiving feedback from friends and early testers.

You can play the game here: https://clujhunt.com/ciphers

For those who don’t feel like playing the game, I made a 2-minute video demo of the decryption tool: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vENHCt25P4M

Disclaimer: There is a $5 paywall after you finish the second puzzle. I don't expect to make money off it at this early stage. Instead, I use the paywall to measure what percentage of people are actually interested in this type of game.

Any feedback would be much appreciated and valuable, just leave a comment, I'll be happy to chat . If you prefer email, my address is: sendtudor@gmail.com

Thanks :) Tudor
stories.title: Show HN: Cryptography Puzzle Game for Geeks

stories.text: I’m traveling to an area of the world where the only communication medium I will have available to me is unlimited 140 character text messages. I’m wondering if it is possible to set up a computer that will allow me to fully interact with it via SMS. I’d like to be able to do things like check the news, read and reply to my emails, check on the status of my home and other servers. What is the state of the art in SMS based human computer interaction?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a pure SMS based UI?
Train Bert Classifier in Browser with TensorflowJS

stories.text:
I've started my journey as a self-taught web developer in 2008, I moved to New York in 2012 and started working for marketing agency as a web developer with a pay of $15 per hour, which has the lowest for the position.

I managed to grow to Tech Director at the same company and my current salary is $110k per year, and yes, I'm still working from paycheck-to-paycheck.

How can I get out of the swamp?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I Stop Living Paycheck to Paycheck?
